title: Pilot traceability of vegetables
description: ユーザーが野菜や果物を買ったり食べたりする際に、その産地や品質をどのように知ることができるのでしょうか。

f6_assessments.q0:
The main problem here is valid (know the quality of vgetables and fruits) and I understand this is a pilot but I dont see in being scalable to larger application in terms of economical viability.

Fruits and vegetables are relatively cheap products and a service like this could make it much more expensive.
Of course, maybe some special target markets like high society fancy restaurant could afford this but even though it's probably not worh it. Besides that, there are more tradional ways to check fruits and vegetables quality.
A small business case could ellaborated considering the audience the proposer wants to target and what would be the price increase on the products if solution is implemented in larger scale, to convince otherwise - and, of course, considering also how much it would be saved with product conservation (maybe a rough estimation net present value).

Although the idea is good, I see it working better for more value added product (wines, whiskey, beers, special meats, seasonings) - of couse, one can start on vegetables and fruits and easily expand to other products, but why not starting in one with more commercial appeal? If theres a reason for that, it should be clear in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
Proposer experience is a bit vague, could have more details on what proceses and projects he participated.

Apart from that, plan is sensible and theres a clear and fair budget breakdown
f6_assessments.q2:
Some milestones are proposed in the plan but no kpis. One suggestions could be how many itens it is intended to be analyized. A final document with all process that was done and lessons learned could also be delivered in the end to make the solution developed here scalable to other products.

I also see plenty of risks in a project like this that should be considered: how to ensure precise measurements in the IoT devices? How to make this economical viable? how to guarantee the output on quality and origen of the product are really true?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does not really describe the problem in detail. It could have provided which parts of food tracking exactly suffer from uncertainty. Also the description on how exactly they want to tackle this challenge could be way more detailed.
f6_assessments.q1: There are projects that have been working for years on a foodtracking solution. Given that the provided roadmap and the timeline are quite vague does not help much. For a challenge like this it would help to clarify the experience (10 years of experience building processes and participating in innovative projects in telecommunications companies) a bit more. Which projects and which companies? Also there could be informations on which ressources are needed. Also for a project like this it would help to provide at least some technical details, maybe a github page?
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap doesn't contain that much informations and mostly contains just words like blockchain and smartcontracts. It doesn't really show how the budget is calculated and how the time horizon is set.

f6_assessments.q0: Supply chain management presents large-scale use based on blockchain technology, WIth different parties feeding handling data in a immutable form to track the movement and storage of agriculture products. In this proposal, a textbook use case is proposed. However, the details regarding the project's scope, the details of the location, and the type of tracked product are not included. The missing details should have enabled a better evaluation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims experience in the telecom industry. However no references to his earlier work or his experience has been included in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks vital data in terms of the scope of the implementation and the desired end state. The audit of the proposal involves physical verification and the posting of data in the blockchain. There is a need for some scaling solution to track vegetable movement in Cardano, and no details regarding software development have been provided. It seems the cost is also grossly underestimated.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is a great idea. The execution part of it seems to be a bit lacking
f6_assessments.q1: Potentially an intriguing concept but there are some major concerns to me. First, there is a budget figure of 13k USD requested. Given that amount, I would expect an appropriate level of depth when addressing how this budget is going to be spent. Second - I am unable to establish validity of claims/experience.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are weakly described. It is only mentioned that further funding will be needed. The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is not defined

f6_assessments.q0: A great idea, the technical side has been addressed however how the proposer would approach the big and small companies selling and buying the stock to agree on the project is not addressed
f6_assessments.q1: As noted the technical side on how the fruits and vegetables would be labelled using codes and tracking has been established but no word on approaching the markets
f6_assessments.q2: Would love to see a plan on how the proposer would approach the companies responsible for purchasing the stock. A marketing strategy perhaps?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal suggests a legitimate problem and then provides the idea of a valid solution. I do have concerns about whether the loT technology is currently available in order to be applied to fruit and vegetables on a large scale cost effective manner. Having said that the proposal still has merit in terms of this is a fast developing field with many new and innovative ideas. With that in mind perhaps if you were to narrow your focus and prepare a small scale proposal that was limited to a small/localised  producer I do believe you would have a quality research proposal that may attract voters.
f6_assessments.q1: Reading this proposal as it stands it is difficult to gauge the level of experience in relation to loT devices being utilised in the fruit and vegetable industry. The idea is sound but the way the proposal is written at present makes it impossible to know what outcomes may be achieved for the funds requested. I would highly recommend the author research the use of loT in the food industry and utilise that research to present a working operational system that could be improved by the use of blockchain technology. I am providing a reference of a paper that I found useful while assessing this proposal. An intelligent loT-based food quality monitoring approach using low cost sensors. Symmetry 2019 Popa et.al.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided certainly is a good starting point to give insight into what the proposer would like to achieve. The budget is straightforward but does raise concerns due to its generic nature. There is insufficient detail to inform us what fruit and/or vegetable is to be targeted and this will have a heavy bearing on the suitability of an loT device(s) to be used. The budget figures do not add up to the requested amount and it is difficult to gauge success of the proposal without specific details about outcomes and what will be produced. Finally, I would like to encourage the author to look for collaboration among the Catalyst community as a refined proposal with specific goals and outcomes could well add value to the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal somewhat fits the challenge it's in, at least the part where there will be applications built. On the other hand there was a mention: 'Automate the process and update real-time tracking data via IoT devices to Blockchain' which i'm not sure fits the challenge, because it's a whole different thing. The impact of the application is great, if it can be done.
f6_assessments.q1:
I'm sceptical if the proposal will be implemented and here are my reasons:
I see that the author has claimed 10 years of relevant experience, but it's hard for me as an assessor to blindly trust that, and it would be very helpful if the proposer has put some kind of credentials: linked in,  firm, some kind of projects already done or any kind of proof of these 10 years of experience.
The author mentioned in the description of the problem, the intent is to mark all packages / fruits or vegetables with some kind of QR and other markers, but there was no mention of a specific region and that leads me to believe the idea was to do it globally. That would have to take into account the supply chain management process of all the worlds producers and align them to have the same standard of markers and IoT devices to keep track of the quality of goods transported, which seems almost impossible to me. A suggestion in that regard would be to talk to a single supplier and start off small as a proof of concept and maybe later move on to more suppliers and later on different countries.
I like the idea about the application thata would be able to digitize the data seen on the marked products once everything is in place (the packages already have a QR code or other marker, and the user will be able to see the history of the product since it was marked) although the author has his job cut out for him.
I don't understand the general plan to install IoT products. Where would those products be installed? Let's take an example of a single thermometer put in a truck to track the temperature is kept bellow a certain degree to ensure product  quality. In this scenario what happens if a different truck is used to supply the product? How about if there are 10 different trucks, are you going to get 10 devices for the 10 trucks. If one of them breaks who is going to repear them? A lot of unanswered questions pop into mi mind, and these are just a few of them, which meet no explanation in the proposal.
I think it's a nice idea, but it needs a lot more planning and thinking through, before there's a working solution.
f6_assessments.q2: There is not information provided on any KPIs or any traceability so I'd say there's no sufficient way to audit the progress of the proposal development. A suggestion for the author would be to keep in mind that this is a very active community which will want to be involved in every step of the process and even help if possible. Think about what a real business plan looks like, because the proposals are literally business plans.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal identifies perhaps a potential problem with the potential targeted market being end consumers of agriculture produces. Ambiguity of the potential users make assessing the impact of this proposal left to the imagination of assessors. In the future it would help if data such as, the potential targeted market to be identified in some form therefore making it capable of assessing the numbers of potential users. This could start from the Problem Statement itself, perhaps it would be better as the following ; e.g. Consumers in high-end restaurants in "country X" need to know their food origins. The goals of this proposal is also limited in terms it seeks to only address the problem brought up by the proposer, it has not entirely connected with the goals of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal although provides a certain degree of experience, it would be helpful to have links to ease verification of the team. In regards towards the team, this proposal still needs time and work to identify the team needed to achieve deliverables mentioned. The budget needed in comparison to the budget allocation need further work for there is a number of funds unaccounted for. This also follows through on the timeline, which might seem too general and may cause confusion. Having a clearly defined process may assist the assessors from refraining doing guesswork. This also continues in the technical aspect of the potential operation of the proposed system, including brief but technical process will help in making accurate assessment, e.g. it is mentioned of the use of IoT connecting to the blockchain. How will be the method of connection? Through some form of oracle? Unfortunately there is also a lack of addressing potential challenges and risk the team might face down the line.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal although provide milestones and roadmaps it is both still vague and exceeds the Challenge parameters. From the timeline the deliverables go well into 2022. KPI are also not provided making it challenging to assess. Although there is a connection between the identified problem and solution, all-in-all it is still disconnected from the Challenge parameters. 

This proposal overall needs further work. Suggest to connect with EMURGO, for they have a working tech that addresses this proposals issue of traceability and with the Catalyst School to build experience and connections to formulate a stronger proposal next time. Looking forward to see this proposal pop-up in the future.
